title: 112_hr3163
content: The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" establishes a minimum early voting period for jurisdictions conducting early voting under the Help America Vote Act of 2002. This new section outlines requirements for states permitting early voting. The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" mandates a 14-day early voting period (including weekends) for states allowing early voting for Federal elections, starting January 1, 2012. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 401 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002. Section 401 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to replace references to specific sections with "subtitle A of title III". A clerical amendment is made to the table of contents of the Act. Section 303B prohibits states from requiring state-issued identification for voting or registering to vote. An election official cannot demand a state-issued ID for voting in federal elections. This does not affect the requirement for certain voters who register by mail to present identification. Each state must comply with this rule. Starting January 1, 2012, each state must require voters to present identification when voting by mail. SEC. 303C. ELECTION DAY REGISTRATION AND CHANGE OF ADDRESS SERVICE. This section requires states to provide same-day voter registration and change of address services. On election day, each State must allow individuals to register and vote at the polling place using a form that meets the requirements of the National Voter Registration Act of 1993. On election day, registered voters can cast their vote at the polling place. If a registered voter moves within the same state without updating their address, they can provide the new address at the polling place using a state-developed form. Registered voters who move within the same state can update their address at the polling place using a state-developed form and cast a regular ballot instead of a provisional one. This requirement does not apply to states without voter registration for federal elections. The Act eliminates the voter registration requirement for individuals in the State for Federal elections. The appropriate election official must transmit voter registration or change of address forms to the State election official along with the ballots. This requirement starts on January 1, 2012. The Act eliminates voter registration requirement for Federal elections in the State. Each State must comply with the new requirements starting January 1, 2012. The Act eliminates voter registration requirement for Federal elections in the State, starting January 1, 2012. Section 303C allows for Election Day registration and change of address service, including at early voting sites. The State must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of the election, as well as provide change of address services, in accordance with section 303C of the Act.
